channel.title: Data API documentation on JIPipe for ImageJ
channel.description: Recent content in Data API documentation on JIPipe for ImageJ

item.title: Data table
item.description: The data table structure is the smallest unit of the data API. Its purpose is to organize data of any supported kind into an annotated table and store all required metadata to recover the data from the file system. A data table is located in a directory within the file system and contains following parts: data-table.json, which contains all metadata and the table row definitions Numeric folders starting from zero (e.

item.title: Row folder
item.description: All data in a data table are stored in numeric folders called “row folders”, each containing the data of one table row. This data stores the raw serialized format, without metadata - metadata is located in data-table.json of the data table. The exact structure of a row folder depends on the data type and is documented in (?) > Data type compendium within JIPipe. Here we will provide you a list of the most important row folder structures supported by JIPipe.

item.title: Pipeline output
item.description: A pipeline output folder is generated on running a pipeline using the Run function or via other means of running the pipeline and saving the results to the hard drive. The generated folder follows a hierarchical structure that is based on the location of data within graph compartments, nodes, and slots. It also contains a copy of the project that generated the data in a file project.jip. mermaid.initialize({startOnLoad:true}); graph LR; Root["
